sen.j: 天ぷら（てんぷら）とは魚介類、野菜、山菜 等に、小麦粉で作った衣をつけて油で揚げた日本料理である。
sen.e: Tempura is a Japanese dish of deep fried battered meats, seafood, vegetables or sansai (plants growing wilds in field and mountains.)
Tempura is a Japanese dish of deep fried battered meats, seafood, vegetables or sansai (plants growing wild in fields and mountains.)
Tempura is a Japanese dish of deep fried battered meats, seafood, vegetables or sansai (plants growing wild in fields and mountains.)

sen.j: 天麩羅、天婦羅とも表記。
sen.e: It is referred to as 天麩羅 and 天婦羅 in Japanese.
It is referred to as 天麩羅 and 天婦羅 in Japanese.
It is referred to as 天麩羅 and 天婦羅 in Japanese.

sen.j: 西日本では薩摩揚げのことも「天ぷら」（「てんぷら」とも表記）と呼ぶ（詳細は「薩摩揚げ」参照）。
sen.e: The word "tempura" is also used to refer to satsuma-age, a fried fish cake (For the details, see the 'satsuma-age section) in the western Japan.
The word "tempura" is also used to refer to satsuma-age, a fried fish cake (For the details, see the 'satsuma-age section) in western Japan.
The word 'tempura' is also used to refer to satsuma-age, a fried fish cake (for the details, see the 'satsuma-age section) in western Japan.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にforを小文字にしました。

sen.j: 日本人にとっては、立ち食いから高級料亭までと食べる機会の多い、非常に馴染み深い料理であり、また海外においては寿司、すきやきと並び、代表的な日本料理とされる。
sen.e: As Japanese people come across lots of opportunities to eat tempura from a standing-up-eating shops to high-class Japanese-style restaurants, it is a very familiar dish in Japan, and is recognized as a typical Japanese dish as well as sushi and sukiyaki abroad.

As Japanese people come across lots of opportunities to eat tempura from a standing-up-eating shops to high-class Japanese-style restaurants, it is a very familiar dish in Japan, and is recognized as a typical Japanese dish as well as sushi and sukiyaki abroad.

As Japanese people come across lots of opportunities to eat tempura from a standing-up-eating shops to high-class Japanese-style restaurants, it is a very familiar dish in Japan, and is recognized as a typical Japanese dish as well as sushi and sukiyaki abroad.

sen.j: サクっとした衣の食感と、旬の食材を楽しむ料理である。
sen.e: Tempura provides an opportunity to enjoy fluffy and crisp tempura structure and eating seasonal food.
Tempura provides an opportunity to enjoy fluffy and crisp tempura and seasonal food.
Tempura provides an opportunity to enjoy fluffy and crisp tempura and seasonal food.

sen.j: タネ（またはネタ）と呼ばれる食材に小麦粉と卵で作った衣をつけ、油で揚げた料理。
sen.e: Ingredients called "tane (or, neta)" are dipped in the batter made with eggs and flour, then deep-fried in heated oil.
Ingredients called "tane (or, neta)" are dipped in a batter made with eggs and flour, then deep-fried in heated oil.
Ingredients called "tane (or, neta)" are dipped in a batter made with eggs and flour, then deep-fried in heated oil.

sen.j: 本来は魚介類をタネとした物のみを天麩羅と呼び、野菜をタネとした物は「精進揚げ」（しょうじんあげ、しょうじあげ）と呼び区別されるが、現在では精進揚げも含めた総称として天ぷらが使われている。
sen.e: In order to distinguish from each other, originally, deep fried battered seafood as neta was only referred to tempura and deep fried vegetables were referred to 'Shojin-age', but the term of tempura is currently used as a general description to refer to tempura including the Shojin-age.

In order to distinguish from each other, originally, deep fried battered seafood as neta was only referred to as tempura and deep fried vegetables were referred to as 'Shojin-age,' but the term of tempura is currently used as a general description to refer to tempura including the Shojin-age.

In order to distinguish from each other, originally, deep fried battered seafood as neta was only referred to as tempura and deep fried vegetables were referred to as 'Shojin-age,' but the term of tempura is currently used as a general description to refer to tempura including the Shojin-age.

sen.j: タネの食材名に「天」を付し「海老天」「ナス天」等と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Adding 'ten' to the name of tane such as Ebi (shrimp) and Nasu (eggplant), deep fried Ebi and Nasu are called 'Ebi-ten (deep-fried shrimp)' and 'Nasu-ten (deep-fried eggplant)', respectively.
Adding 'ten' to the name of tane such as Ebi (shrimp) and Nasu (eggplant), deep fried Ebi and Nasu are called 'Ebi-ten (deep-fried shrimp)' and 'Nasu-ten (deep-fried eggplant),' respectively.
Adding 'ten' to the name of tane such as Ebi (shrimp) and Nasu (eggplant), deep fried Ebi and Nasu are called 'Ebi-ten (deep-fried shrimp)' and 'Nasu-ten (deep-fried eggplant),' respectively.

sen.j: 代表的なタネとしてエビ、イカ、茄子、ししとう、さつまいも、かぼちゃ等を挙げることが出来るが、特に種類は限定されず、季節折々の食材を楽しむのが最大の醍醐味と言える。
sen.e: Common tane in traditional tempura includes shrimp, squid, eggplant, sweet pepper, sweet potato and kabocha squash (pumpkin), and greatest benefits are to enjoy seasonal ingredients without particularly limiting kinds of tane.

Common tane in traditional tempura includes shrimp, squid, eggplant, sweet pepper, sweet potato, and kabocha squash (pumpkin), and the greatest benefits are to enjoy seasonal ingredients without particularly limiting kinds of tane.

Common tane in traditional tempura includes shrimp, squid, eggplant, sweet pepper, sweet potato, and kabocha squash (pumpkin), and the greatest benefits are to enjoy seasonal ingredients without particularly limiting kinds of tane.

sen.j: ただし、肉類は基本的にタネとはならない（大分県の郷土料理の鳥天のような例外はある）。
sen.e: However, meats are generally improper for tempura tane (except for Toriten or deep-fried chicken as local dish in Oita Prefecture.)
However, meats are generally improper for tempura tane (except for Toriten or deep-fried chicken as local dish in Oita Prefecture.)
However, meats are generally improper for tempura tane (except for Toriten or deep-fried chicken as local dish in Oita Prefecture.)

sen.j: 和食の華の1つと位置付けられることが多く、単純な調理方法ながら料理人の技術が端的に味に表れる。
sen.e: Tempura is often considered as an appealing dish among Japanese foods, and chef's skill and technique are exactly reflected in taste, though the cooking process is simple.
Tempura is often considered an appealing dish among Japanese foods, and chef's skill and technique are exactly reflected in the taste, though the cooking process is simple.
Tempura is often considered an appealing dish among Japanese foods, and chef's skill and technique are exactly reflected in the taste, although the cooking process is simple.

sen.j: 蕎麦や饂飩と共に食べられる事も多い。
sen.e: Tempura is often served with soba (noodle made from buckwheat) and udon wheat noodle.
Tempura is often served with soba (noodles made from buckwheat) and udon wheat noodles.
Tempura is often served with soba (noodles made from buckwheat) and udon wheat noodles.

sen.j: 寿司屋に似ており、カウンターの前に種の入ったショーケースがあり、職人が目の前で揚げて客へ提供する。
sen.e: A restaurant of tempura resembles a sushi restaurant in several aspects and cooks deep-fry tane stored in a showcase on a counter in front of customers and serve it to them.
A tempura restaurant resembles a sushi restaurant in several aspects and cooks deep-fry tane stored in a showcase on a counter in front of customers and serve it to them.
A tempura restaurant resembles a sushi restaurant in several aspects and cooks deep-fry tane stored in a showcase on a counter in front of customers and serve it to them.

sen.j: 関西では調理場であげたものを出す。
sen.e: In the Kansai, tempura prepared in a kitchen is served to customers.
In Kansai, tempura prepared in a kitchen is served to customers.
In Kansai, tempura prepared in a kitchen is served to customers.

sen.j: 薄力粉、鶏卵、冷水を軽く混ぜ合わせて衣を作り、食材をくぐらせ160～180℃の油で揚げる。
sen.e: A light batter is made of cold water, eggs and wheat flour, and the ingredients are dipped in the batter and deep fried using oil of 160 to 180 degrees Celsius.
A light batter is made of cold water, eggs and wheat flour, and the ingredients are dipped into the batter and deep fried using oil at a temperature of 160 to 180 degrees Celsius.
A light batter is made of cold water, eggs and wheat flour, and the ingredients are dipped into the batter and deep fried using oil at a temperature of 160 to 180 degrees Celsius.

sen.j: サクッとした食感に揚げるにはコツを要す。
sen.e: It needs a skill to cook crispier tempura.
It requires skill to cook crispier tempura.
It requires skill to cook crispier tempura.

sen.j: 不慣れな人間が作ると衣がもったりとなり、油が切れず、非常に食感が悪い物が出来上がる事となる。
sen.e: Unskilled person may cook tempura with oily and heavy coating, resulting in very bad quality.
An unskilled person may be able to cook tempura with a heavy oily coating, resulting in very bad quality.
An unskilled person may be able to cook tempura with a heavy oily coating, resulting in very bad quality.

sen.j: また衣に「華を咲かせる」と呼ばれ、衣を大きく見せ、よりサクッとした食感にさせる技法がある。
sen.e: They say 'to make the coating fluffy and in full bloom', and there is a technique to make the coating look bigger and taste crisp texture.
A chef should be able 'to make the coating fluffy and in full bloom,' and there is a technique to make the coating look bigger and have a tasty crispy texture.
A chef should be able 'to make the coating fluffy and in full bloom,' and there is a technique to make the coating look bigger and have a tasty crispy texture.

sen.j: 麺類の種物等に使われるが、美しく見栄えのする華を咲かせるには、熟練した技が必要になる。
sen.e: Tempura is served with noodles as Tanemono (topping for noodles), and it requires a practiced skill to make the coating fluffy and distinguished-looking.
Tempura is served with noodles as Tanemono (topping for noodles), and it requires a practiced skill to make the coating fluffy and distinguished-looking.
Tempura is served with noodles as Tanemono (topping for noodles), and it requires a practiced skill to make the coating fluffy and distinguished-looking.

sen.j: なお、天丼にする場合やかき揚げの場合は衣を厚めにする。
sen.e: In case of tendon (a tempura rice bowl) and kakiage (deep-fried vegetable strips, shrimp, etc.), thicker coating is recommendable.
In case of tendon (a tempura rice bowl) and kakiage (deep-fried vegetable strips, shrimp, etc.), a thicker coating is recommendable.
In case of tendon (a tempura rice bowl) and kakiage (deep-fried vegetable strips, shrimp, etc.), a thicker coating is recommendable.

sen.j: 天麩羅を作るときのコツとして
sen.e: For tips useful to cook tempura,
For tips useful in cooking tempura,
For tips useful in cooking tempura,

sen.j: よく冷やす
sen.e: Keep it cold.
Keep it cold.
Keep it cold.

sen.j: 混ぜすぎない
sen.e: Don't over-mix it.
Don't over-mix it.
Don't over-mix it.

sen.j: という事が挙げられる。
sen.e: are some important tips.
are some important tips.
are some important tips.

sen.j: これらはさくっとした食感には邪魔な小麦粉のグルテン生成を抑えるための方法である。
sen.e: These are the procedures to prevent the production of wheat gluten, which may cause an obstacle for crisp texture.
These are the procedures to prevent the production of wheat gluten, which may prevent a crisp texture.
These are the procedures to prevent the production of wheat gluten, which may prevent a crisp texture.

sen.j: グルテン生成の少ない、古くなった小麦粉を敢えて使うこともある。
sen.e: Old wheat flour which is apt to produce less amount of gluten may be intentionally used.
Old wheat flour which is apt to produce a lesser amount of gluten may be intentionally used.
Old wheat flour which is apt to produce a lesser amount of gluten may be intentionally used.

sen.j: なお、小麦粉のダマがなくなるまでかき混ぜるのはよくない。
sen.e: It is improper to mix the batter until no lumps of flour are left in the mixture.
It is improper to mix the batter until no lumps of flour are left in the mixture.
It is improper to mix the batter until no lumps of flour are left in the mixture.

sen.j: 近年ではカラッと揚がるように、発泡性の炭酸水素ナトリウムやベーキングパウダーなどが加えられた「天ぷら粉」が市販されており、一般家庭で天ぷらを作る際に利用されている。
sen.e: To cook crisp tempura, tempura-ko (flour for tempura) which is formulated with the additions of leaveners such as sodium hydrogen carbonate and baking powder is available in supermarkets in recent years, and is used for home-made tempura.
sen.cmt: 発泡性は誤りのようで、発酵性のようです。
sen.e: To cook crisp tempura, tempura-ko (flour for tempura) which is formulated with the additions of leaveners such as sodium hydrogen carbonate and baking powder is available in supermarkets in recent years, and is used for home-made tempura.

To cook crisp tempura, tempura-ko (flour for tempura) which is formulated with the effervescent additives such as sodium hydrogen carbonate and baking powder is available in supermarkets in recent years, and is used for home-made tempura.
sen.cmt: 「発泡性は誤りのようで、発酵性のようです。」とコメントにありますが、原文の通り「発泡性」で正しいと思います。additions of leaveners→effervescent additives

sen.j: 揚げ油は天ぷらの香りを決定付ける重要な要素であり、専門店等ではごま油、綿実油等を独自に配合して使っている。
sen.e: Since deep frying oil is a crucial factor to determine the flavor of tempura, specialty shops use the mixture of sesame oil and cotton oil according to their own formula.
Since deep frying oil is a crucial factor to determine the flavor of tempura, specialty shops use the mixture of sesame oil and cotton oil according to their own formula.
Since deep frying oil is a crucial factor to determine the flavor of tempura, specialty shops use the mixture of sesame oil and cotton oil according to their own formula.

sen.j: 高級店や産地では椿油を用いる場合もある。
sen.e: Camellia oil may be used in expensive restaurants and local shops or restaurants.
Camellia oil may be used in expensive restaurants and local shops or restaurants.
Camellia oil may be used in expensive restaurants and local shops or restaurants.

sen.j: 家庭ではサラダ油が用いられる事が多いが、少量のごま油を足すだけで仕上がりは大幅に良くなる。
sen.e: Salad oil is popular for home-made tempura, and adding a bit sesame oil will enhance the finish of tempura very much.
Salad oil is popular for home-made tempura, and adding a bit sesame oil will enhance the finish of tempura quite a bit more.
Salad oil is popular for home-made tempura, and adding a bit sesame oil will enhance the finish of tempura quite a bit more.

sen.j: 一般に関東では香りの良い胡麻油、関西ではクセのない植物油を使う傾向が見られる。
sen.e: There is a general tendency toward using luscious sesame oil in the Kanto and mild vegetable oil in the Kansai.
There is a general tendency toward using luscious sesame oil in Kanto and mild vegetable oil in Kansai.
There is a general tendency toward using luscious sesame oil in Kanto and mild vegetable oil in Kansai.

sen.j: タネに決まりがあるわけではないが、高温の調理で硬くなる物（ハマグリ・イカなど）は避けられる。
sen.e: Although the kinds of tane are not determined, it is common to avoid foods (clams (common orient clam), squid, etc.) which may harden by cooking at a high temperature.
Although the kinds of tane are not determined, it is common to avoid foods (clams - common orient clam, squid, etc.) which may harden when cookied at a high temperature.
Although the kinds of tane are not determined, it is common to avoid foods (clams - common orient clam, squid, etc.) which may harden when cooked at a high temperature.

sen.j: 山菜や野草の場合、他の調理法ではアク抜きなどの下処理が必要となるが、天ぷらにおいてはほとんど必要がなく、摘み草などで山野草を手早く味わいたい場合に多く用いられる。
sen.e: In case of Sansai and Sanyaso (plants growing wilds in field and mountains), preparations such as removing scum are necessary in other methods of cooking, but are hardly required for tempura, and tempura cooking is very popular when people want to taste picked Sanyaso promptly at a Sanyaso picking gathering.

In case of Sansai and Sanyaso (plants growing wild in fields and mountains), preparations such as removing scum are necessary in other methods of cooking, but are hardly required for tempura, and tempura cooking is very popular when people want to taste picked Sanyaso promptly at a Sanyaso picking gathering.

In case of Sansai and Sanyaso (plants growing wild in fields and mountains), preparations such as removing scum are necessary in other methods of cooking, but are hardly required for tempura, and tempura cooking is very popular when people want to taste picked Sanyaso promptly at a Sanyaso picking gathering.

sen.j: 油で揚げている最中にはタネの温度が急上昇するため、衣に閉じ込められた空気や水分（水蒸気）が破裂することがあるので注意が必要。
sen.e: The temperature of tane can sharply rise during cooking and it should be careful about bursting caused by the air or steam enclosed between the tane and the batter.
The temperature of tane can sharply rise during cooking and care should be taken about bursting caused by the air or steam enclosed between the tane and the batter.
The temperature of tane can sharply rise during cooking and care should be taken about bursting caused by the air or steam enclosed between the tane and the batter.

sen.j: 特に尾のついた海老を調理する際は、下処理として尾の先端を切り、中に含まれる水分を抜くといった下処理が必要となる。
sen.e: Particularly, when a shrimp with a tail is deep fried, splitting the tip of the tail should be prepared beforehand to take out the water/liquid contained in it.
Particularly, when a shrimp with a tail is deep fried, splitting the tip of the tail should be done beforehand to take out the water/liquid contained in it.
Particularly, when a shrimp with a tail is deep fried, splitting the tip of the tail should be done beforehand to take out the water/liquid contained in it.

sen.j: また仕上りを美しくするためにはタネに隠し包丁を入れておいたり、筋切りをしておくと良い。
sen.e: Also, to ensure the distinguished-looking finish of tempura, it is advisable to apply invisible splits or cuts to tane or cut strings.
Also, to ensure the distinguished-looking finish of tempura, it is advisable to apply invisible splits or cuts to tane or cut strings.
Also, to ensure the distinguished-looking finish of tempura, it is advisable to apply invisible splits or cuts to tane or cut strings.

sen.j: 単品として食べる場合、天つゆで食するのが一般的であり、食材によっては柑橘類の絞り汁だけをかけて食べる事もある。
sen.e: When tempura is served as a single dish, seasoning soy sauce is customarily used to dip it, and depending on the ingredients, citrus fruit juice may be an alternative sauce.
When tempura is served as a single dish, seasoning soy sauce is customarily used to dip it, and depending on the ingredients, citrus fruit juice may be an alternative sauce.
When tempura is served as a single dish, seasoning soy sauce is customarily used to dip it, and depending on the ingredients, citrus fruit juice may be an alternative sauce.

sen.j: 天つゆは出汁と醤油が基本となるつけ汁で、大根おろし、紅葉おろし、おろしショウガ等が薬味として用いられる。
sen.e: Seasoning soy sauce is basically made from dashi (Japanese soup stock made from fish and kelp) and soy sauce, and served as dipping sauce with spices such as grated daikon radish, a mixture of grated daikon radish and red pepper and/or grated ginger.

Soy sauce seasoning is basically made from dashi (Japanese soup stock made from fish and kelp) and soy sauce, and served as dipping sauce with spices such as grated daikon radish, a mixture of grated daikon radish and red pepper and/or grated ginger.

Soy sauce seasoning is basically made from dashi (Japanese soup stock made from fish and kelp) and soy sauce, and served as dipping sauce with spices such as grated daikon radish, a mixture of grated daikon radish and red pepper and/or grated ginger.

sen.j: また素材そのものの繊細な味を楽しむために付け塩で食べることも多い。
sen.e: Also, in order to enjoy the sophisticated taste of the ingredients, salt is very common for the substitute of dipping sauce.
Also, in order to enjoy the sophisticated taste of the ingredients, salt is very common for the substitute of dipping sauce.
Also, in order to enjoy the sophisticated taste of the ingredients, salt is very common for the substitute of dipping sauce.

sen.j: 塩は単なる粗塩の他、抹茶（抹茶塩）、カレー粉（カレー塩）、ユズ皮（柚子塩）、山椒等が混ぜられる事もある。
sen.e: Plain arajio (salt) and the mixture of the plain arajio and other ingredients such as Matcha (green powdered tea) (Matcha salt), curry powder (curry salt), Japanese lemon peel (Japanese lemon salt) and sansho (Chinese pepper) will be served with tempura.

Plain arajio (salt) and the mixture of the plain arajio and other ingredients such as Matcha (green powdered tea) (Matcha salt), curry powder (curry salt), Japanese lemon peel (Japanese lemon salt) and sansho (Chinese pepper) will be served with tempura.

Plain arajio (salt) and the mixture of the plain arajio and other ingredients such as Matcha (green powdered tea) (Matcha salt), curry powder (curry salt), Japanese lemon peel (Japanese lemon salt) and sansho (Chinese pepper) will be served with tempura.

sen.j: 家庭料理としては醤油、ウスターソースをつけて食べる地域もある。
sen.e: There are the regions where local people eat tempura dipping in soy sauce and Worcester sauce.
There are regions where local people eat tempura dipped in soy sauce and Worcester sauce.
There are regions where local people eat tempura dipped in soy sauce and Worcester sauce.

sen.j: ソースを付けて食べるのは西日本に多い。
sen.e: Worcester sauce is more popular in the western Japan.
Worcester sauce is more popular in the western Japan.
Worcester sauce is more popular in the western Japan.

sen.j: 白飯にのせ、タレをかけた「天丼」、蕎麦・うどんにのせた「天麩羅蕎麦」・「天麩羅饂飩」も一般的な料理であり、多くの蕎麦屋では丼類、麺類それぞれの最高級メニューとして花形を飾っている。
sen.e: Tendon (tempura placed on top of steamed rice in a bowl with sauce sprinkled over it)', 'Tempura-soba (buckwheat noodle topped with tempura prawns)' and 'Tempura-udon (wheat noodle topped with tempura prawns)' are common dishes, and these three kinds of dishes are the most expensive and star dishes in donburi and noodle menus each in many soba restaurants.

Tendon (tempura placed on top of steamed rice in a bowl with sauce sprinkled over it),' 'Tempura-soba (buckwheat noodles topped with tempura prawns)' and 'Tempura-udon (wheat noodle topped with tempura prawns)' are common dishes, and these three kinds of dishes are the most expensive and star dishes in donburi and noodle menus in many soba restaurants.

Tendon (tempura placed on top of steamed rice in a bowl with sauce sprinkled over it),' 'Tempura-soba (buckwheat noodles topped with tempura prawns)' and 'Tempura-udon (wheat noodle topped with tempura prawns)' are common dishes, and these three kinds of dishes are the most expensive and star dishes in donburi and noodle menus in many soba restaurants.

sen.j: この他、白飯に掻き揚げをのせてワサビを添え、出汁や緑茶をかけた「天茶」（天ぷら茶漬け）という食べ方もある。
sen.e: In addition, there is another dish called 'tencha (Tempura-chazuke: steamed rice topped with kakiage and hot green tea)' in which dashi or green tea is powered over steamed rice topped with kakiage and wasabi (Japanese horse radish.)

In addition, there is another dish called 'tencha (Tempura-chazuke: steamed rice topped with kakiage and hot green tea)' in which dashi or green tea is powered over steamed rice topped with kakiage and wasabi (Japanese horse radish.)

In addition, there is another dish called 'tencha (Tempura-chazuke: steamed rice topped with kakiage and hot green tea)' in which dashi or green tea is powered over steamed rice topped with kakiage and wasabi (Japanese horse radish.)

tit.j: 多人数による卓上での調理
tit.e: Self-cooking by a group of people
Self-cooking by a group of people
Self-cooking by a group of people

sen.j: 食卓にコンロ（または電磁調理器）と天ぷら鍋を置き、次々と衣を着けた天ぷらを揚げ、何人かで取り囲んで鍋料理のように食べる、オイルフォンデュのような形式もある。
sen.e: There is a cooking similar to an oil fondue style in which a group of people set a deep fryer on a portable stove (or an electromagnetic cooker) on a dining table and deep-fry battered ingredients in heated cooking oil, just like a Nabe-ryori (hot pot.)

There is cooking similar to oil fondue style in which a group of people set a deep fryer on a portable stove (or an electromagnetic cooker) on a dining table and deep-fry battered ingredients in heated cooking oil, just like a Nabe-ryori (hot pot.)

There is cooking similar to oil fondue style in which a group of people set a deep fryer on a portable stove (or an electromagnetic cooker) on a dining table and deep-fry battered ingredients in heated cooking oil, just like a Nabe-ryori (hot pot.)

sen.j: これを「お座敷天ぷら」と呼ぶこともある。
sen.e: This may be called 'Ozashiki-Tempura (tempura is cooked directly by eaters in a room.)'
sen.cmt: 「お座敷」とは、必ずしも畳部屋を指しておらず板かもしれない。キッチンで調理するのでなく、部屋で、食べる人が自ら揚げて食べる形態のことを指すと解釈しました。
sen.e: This may be called 'Ozashiki-Tempura (tempura is cooked directly by the eaters in a room.)'
This may be called 'Ozashiki-Tempura (tempura is cooked directly by the eaters in a room.)'

sen.j: 戦国時代の16世紀頃に、キリスト教の宣教師達によって伝来された。
sen.e: Tempura was introduced by missionary priests in the 16th century of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States.)
Tempura was introduced by missionary priests in the 16th century of the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States.)
Tempura was introduced by missionary priests in the 16th century of the Sengoku period (period of Warring States.)

sen.j: 宣教師達は、水で溶いた小麦粉の衣で魚をまとい、熱い油で揚げて食べたとされる。
sen.e: Priests seemed to dip fish into batter made of water and wheat and deep-fry it in heated cooking oil.
Priests seemed to dip fish into batter made of water and wheat and deep-fry it in heated cooking oil.
Priests seemed to dip fish into batter made of water and wheat and deep-fry it in heated cooking oil.

sen.j: 当時は「南蛮焼き」と呼ばれていたと伝えられる。
sen.e: It is thought to have been called 'Nanbanyaki' at that time.
It is thought to have been called 'Nanbanyaki' at that time.
It is thought to have been called 'Nanbanyaki' at that time.

sen.j: ただし、当初伝えられたレシピは、現代のフリッターの原型と思われる。
sen.e: However, the recipe initially introduced seems to be an original form for the current fritter.
However, the recipe initially introduced seems to be an original form for the current fritter.

sen.j: フリッターはふんわりした衣であるのに対して、天ぷらの衣はサクサクしており別物である。
sen.e: Fritter is coved with soft and fluffy coating, while tempura is covered with crisp coating, that is different from each other.
Fritter is covered with a soft and fluffy coating, while tempura is covered with a crisp coating, that is different.
Fritter is covered with a soft and fluffy coating, while tempura is covered with a crisp coating, that is different.

sen.j: よって、日本料理としての「天ぷら」は日本独自の料理と言えるであろう。
sen.e: Therefore, 'tempura' as a Japanese dish can be said to be a unique dish in Japan.
Therefore, 'tempura' as a Japanese dish can be said to be a unique dish in Japan.
Therefore, 'tempura' as a Japanese dish can be said to be a unique dish in Japan.

sen.j: 江戸時代には、天ぷらは屋台などで売られた庶民の手軽な食事だった。
sen.e: In the Edo era, tempura was a convenient dish which was very available for ordinary people at food stalls.
In the Edo era, tempura was a convenient dish which was very available for ordinary people at food stalls.
In the Edo period, tempura was a convenient dish which was very available for ordinary people at food stalls.

sen.j: それが江戸前は炒り胡麻油で、京都などは綿実油を使用し、料理店でだされるようになり、後には高級料理にもなった。
sen.e: Later, tempura prepared using sesame oil in Edomae (Tokyo style) and cotton oil in Kyoto began to be offered in restaurants, and became an expensive dish in later years.
Later, tempura prepared using sesame oil in Edomae (Tokyo style) and cotton oil in Kyoto began to be offered in restaurants, and became an expensive dish in later years.

sen.j: 天ぷらの語源については、諸説あり。
sen.e: There are several views about the origin of the word "tempura,"
There are several views about the origin of the word "tempura,"
There are several views about the origin of the word "tempura".

sen.j: ポルトガル語の temporas （斎時の意）
sen.e: the Portuguese temporas (referring to sacred period of time)
the Portuguese temporas (referring to sacred period of time)

sen.j: ポルトガル語の tempero （調味料の意）
sen.e: the Portuguese tempero (referring to seasoning)
the Portuguese tempero (referring to seasoning)
the Portuguese tempero (referring to seasoning)

sen.j: ポルトガル語の temperar （動詞：調味料を加える、又は油を使用して硬くするの意）動詞を変化すると、三人称単数形でTEMPERAとなる（例、食べ物に調味料を加える、又は食べ物を油で硬くするにする）
sen.e: Inflection of the Portuguese temperar (verb: referring to "add seasoning" or "firm up using oil") to third person singular is TEMPERA (e.g. add seasoning to food or firm up food using oil.)
Inflection of the Portuguese temperar (verb: referring to "add seasoning" or "firm up using oil") to third person singular is TEMPERA (e.g. add seasoning to food or firm up food using oil.)

sen.j: スペイン語およびポルトガル語の templo （寺院の意）
sen.e: the Spanish and Portuguese templo (referring to temple)
the Spanish and Portuguese templo (referring to temple)

sen.j: スペイン語およびイタリア語の tempora （四季の斎日の意）

the Spanish and Italian tempora (referring to Imibi (holy day - in four seasons)

sen.j: 上記などから転じたという説がある。
sen.e: It is thought to have been derived from these.
It is thought to have been derived from these.

sen.j: 「天麩羅」は後世の当て字で、江戸時代に山東京伝が考え出したという説がある。
sen.e: It is thought that 'Tempura (天麩羅)' was a phonetic equivalent born in later years and coined by Kyoden SANTO in the Edo era.
It is thought that 'Tempura (天麩羅)' was a phonetic equivalent born in later years and coined by Kyoden SANTO during the Edo era.
It is thought that 'Tempura (天麩羅)' was a phonetic equivalent born in later years and coined by Kyoden SANTO during the Edo period.

sen.j: 「天ぷら」とは当初、海外から九州・沖縄県方面に入ってきた油料理の総称であったとされ、後には薩摩揚げ等の、以前より日本にあった油料理も含めた名称となった。
sen.e: It is thought that the term "tempura" was initially a general description of oil-cooked dishes introduced from overseas to Kyushu and Okinawa Prefecture and became widely used to refer to any sort of food prepared using hot oil, including some already existing Japanese foods such as satsuma age (a fried fish cake which is made without batter.)

It is thought that the term "tempura" was initially a general description of oil-cooked dishes introduced from overseas to Kyushu and Okinawa Prefecture and became widely used to refer to any sort of food prepared using hot oil, including some already existing Japanese foods such as satsuma age (a fried fish cake which is made without batter.)

It is thought that the term 'tempura' was initially a general description of oil-cooked dishes introduced from overseas to Kyushu region and Okinawa Prefecture and became widely used to refer to any sort of food prepared using hot oil, including some already existing Japanese foods such as satsuma age (a fried fish cake which is made without batter.)

sen.j: しかし時代が下り、江戸時代に入ると魚介類を原材料とした物のみを「天ぷら」と呼ぶ様になり、野菜類を揚げたものを精進揚げ（しょうじんあげ）として区別する様になる。
sen.e: As time passed and entered the Edo era, deep-fried fish and seafood only were called 'tempura', and deep-fried vegetables were called Shojin-age in order to distinguish it from tempura.
As time passed into the Edo era, deep-fried fish and seafood only were called 'tempura', and deep-fried vegetables were called Shojin-age in order to distinguish it from tempura.
As time passed into the Edo period, deep-fried fish and seafood only were called 'tempura', and deep-fried vegetables were called Shojin-age in order to distinguish it from tempura.

sen.j: また、衣に卵黄を多く使ったものを金ぷら、卵白を使ったものを銀ぷらと呼び分けられていた。
sen.e: Tempura covered by coating using more egg yolks was called Kinpura, and using more egg whites was called Ginpura.
Tempura covered by coating using more egg yolks was called Kinpura, and using more egg whites was called Ginpura.
Tempura covered by coating using more egg yolks was called Kinpura, and using more egg whites was called Ginpura.

sen.j: 現在はすべて天ぷらという名称に変えられており、こうした名称は一部でのみ使用されている。
sen.e: At present, those past different names were unified to tempura and the above naming is available only in part of Japan.
At present, those past differing names were unified to tempura and the above naming is available only in part of Japan.

sen.j: 細かく切り刻んだ、あるいは元から細かい野菜類や魚介類を衣と混ぜ合わせて揚げたものを掻き揚げという。
sen.e: There is kakiage which is prepared by deep-frying the mixture of chopped or originally small vegetables and fishy and seafood and batter in heated oil.
There is kakiage which is prepared by deep-frying the mixture of chopped or originally small vegetables and fish and seafood and batter in heated oil.
There is kakiage which is prepared by deep-frying the mixture of chopped or originally small vegetables and fish and seafood and batter in heated oil.

sen.j: また、青海苔を混ぜた衣を使ったものや、板海苔をタネに巻いたもの、あるいは板海苔に衣を付けて揚げたもの（衣は主に片面だけに付けられる）は磯辺揚げ（いそべあげ）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Also, there is Isobe-age (deep-fried vegetables or meats with Itanori), which is prepared by deep-frying the mixture of green laver and batter, ingredients wrapped only by Itanori (sheeted green laver) and ingredients with battered Itanori (put batter on one side of Itanori.)

Also, there is Isobe-age (deep-fried vegetables or meats with Itanori), which is prepared by deep-frying the mixture of green laver and batter, ingredients wrapped only by Itanori (sheeted green laver) and ingredients with battered Itanori (batter put on one side of Itanori.)

Also, there is Isobe-age (deep-fried vegetables or meats with Itanori), which is prepared by deep-frying the mixture of green laver and batter, ingredients wrapped only by Itanori (sheeted green laver) and ingredients with battered Itanori (batter put on one side of Itanori.)

sen.j: アイスクリームの天ぷら冷たいアイスクリームを熱い油で揚げるが溶けていないということで話題となった。
sen.e: Deep-fried ice cream, which got into the news because a frozen ice cream did not melt despite being prepared using hot oil.
Deep-fried ice cream, which got into the news because the frozen ice cream did not melt despite being prepared using hot oil.
Deep-fried ice cream, which got into the news because the frozen ice cream did not melt despite being prepared using hot oil.

sen.j: アイスクリームをカステラなど空気を多く含む素材で包み素早く揚げると、空気により内部への熱伝導が妨げられるためアイスクリームは溶けない。
sen.e: When an ice cream wrapped with castella sponge cake or other food absorbing a lot of air is quickly deep-fried, the ice cream does not melt because the air prevents the heat from transferring to the inside.

sen.e: Deep-fried manju (bun stuffed with adzuki-bean paste) is mainly referred to battered and deep-fried Saka-manju (sake liquor bun stuffed with adzuki-bean paste) and some of deep-fried manju have been commercialized as age-manju (deep-fried bun with adzuki-bean paste.) sen.j: 干し柿の天ぷら干し柿の中をくり抜き、辛子を詰めて衣を付けて揚げた物。

sen.j: 普茶料理においては、梅干を水に一昼夜つけて塩気を抜いたものをシロップで甘く煮付け、これを衣に付けて揚げる。
sen.e: To be served in Fucha-ryori (maigre dish using certain foods), salt should be removed from umeboshi placing it in water for a long time and cooked in syrup and the sweetened umeboshi is deep-fried after battered.

sen.j: 長崎天ぷらフリッターによく似た製法だが牛乳は用いず、小麦粉・卵・日本酒で衣を作る。

Okinawa tempura is often served for a tea break or as a snack.

sen.j: 魚屋や駄菓子屋で販売されており、店先や持ち帰って食べる。
sen.e: It is sold at fish shops or mom-and-pop candy shops, and eaten at the shop or for to-go.
It is sold at fish shops or mom-and-pop candy shops, and eaten at the shop or for to-go.

sen.j: また仕出し屋で重詰めにして販売される。
sen.e: Also, Okinawa tempura packed in a Jubako is sold by catering businesses.
Also, Okinawa tempura packed in a Jubako is sold by catering businesses.

sen.j: 沖縄で天ぷらと言うとこの食品を指すことが多いが、上述のような一般的な天ぷらももちろん存在する。
sen.e: In Okinawa, the term 'tempura' is often referred to Okinawa tempura, but there is of course regular tempura described above.

sen.j: また、沖縄のお菓子であるサーターアンダーギーは「砂糖天ぷら」と呼ばれることもあり、これは本土共通語へのほぼ直訳にあたる。
sen.e: Sata andagi (sweet deep-fried buns of dough), sweet in Okinawa may be called 'sugar tempura', and is an almost direct translation in terms of the common language in main land.

sen.j: めんたいこ天ぷらめんたいこの特産地である博多で食べられる。
sen.e: Deep-fried Mentaiko (spicy cod roe, salted for preservation and spiced with Korean chili pepper), which is available in Hakata which Mentaiko is a specialty for.
Deep-fried Mentaiko (spicy cod roe, salted for preservation and spiced with Korean chili pepper), which is available in Hakata which Mentaiko is a specialty for.

sen.j: 徳川家康の死因は、鯛の天ぷらに当たったせいであるとの俗説がある。
sen.e: According to the myth, Ieyasu TOKUNAGA died from a bad deep-fried sea beam.
According to the myth, Ieyasu TOKUNAGA died from a bad deep-fried sea beam.
According to the myth, Ieyasu TOKUNAGA died from a bad deep-fried sea beam.

sen.j: ただしこの時代には衣を付けて揚げるタイプの天ぷらは一般的ではなかったため、薩摩揚げに近い物と考えられている。
sen.e: Since it was not common to deep-fry battered foods in that era, it is believed that deep-fried sea beam was similar to Satsuma-age.

sen.j: 江戸時代には江戸城内において天ぷらを揚げる事が禁止されていた。
sen.e: In the Edo Era, tempura cooking was prohibited in the Edo Castle.
During the Edo Era, tempura cooking was prohibited in the Edo Castle.
During the Edo period, tempura cooking was prohibited in the Edo Castle.
sen.cmt: eraを小文字にしました。era→periodに変更しました。

sen.j: これは上記の俗説により天ぷらが忌避された為と言われた。
sen.e: It was believed that tempura was refused due to the above myth.
It was believed that tempura was refused due to the above myth.
It was believed that tempura was refused due to the above myth.

sen.j: しかし真相は奥女中の一人が天ぷらを揚げていた時の失敗で火事を出しかけた事件があった為である。
sen.e: But, the truth was when one of Oku-jochu (maids working for the daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) of shogun family) was cooking tempura, she almost started a fire.
But, the truth was when one of Oku-jochu (maids working for the daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) of shogun family) was cooking tempura, she almost caught on fire.
But, the truth was when one of Oku-jochu (maids working for the daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) of shogun family) was cooking tempura, she almost caught on fire.

sen.j: 和菓子の製造工程において、製品の表面を糖蜜や羊羹等でコーティングする事を「てんぷら」という。
sen.e: In the course of the production of the confectioneries, it is called 'tempura' to apply coating to the surface of Japanese confectioneries with molasses or Yokan (adzuki-bean jelly.)
In the course of the production of confectioneries, it was called 'tempura' to apply coating to the surface of Japanese confectioneries with molasses or Yokan (adzuki-bean jelly.)

sen.j: 野球やゴルフで、意図せずに高く上がってしまったボールを指して「テンプラ」という（球を打ち「あげる」と天麩羅を「あげる」）。
sen.e: When a ball is unintentionally hit very high in the air in a golf competition or baseball game, it is called 'tempura' ('ageru' a ball and 'ageru' tempura.)
When a ball is unintentionally hit very high in the air in a golf competition or baseball game, it is called 'tempura' ('ageru' a ball and 'ageru' tempura.)

sen.j: はんだ付けで、はんだの中に空洞ができて接合不良になったものを「天ぷらはんだ」という。
sen.e: When there occurs an air hole in solder connections due to poor soldering, this is called 'tempura handa (soldering.)
When there occurs an air hole in solder connections due to poor soldering, this is called 'tempura handa (soldering.)
When there occurs an air hole in solder connections due to poor soldering, this is called 'tempura handa (soldering).'

sen.j: 過度に華を咲かせる事により、小さな海老をまるで大海老であるかの様に見せかけた海老天が多々見られることから、「見かけ倒し」や「中身を伴わない」状態の比喩として利用される。
sen.e: There are many Ebi-ten prepared to make a small shrimp look very big because of fluffy coating, and the word 'Ebi-ten' is used as a metaphor when a certain situation is described 'misleading' or 'empty inside.'

There are many Ebi-ten prepared to make a small shrimp look very big using the fluffy coating, and the word 'Ebi-ten' is used as a metaphor when a certain situation is described 'misleading' or 'empty inside.'

There are many Ebi-ten prepared to make a small shrimp look very big using the fluffy coating, and the word 'Ebi-ten' is used as a metaphor when a certain situation is described 'misleading' or 'empty inside.'

sen.j: 自動車やオートバイのスピードメーターを実際に出ているスピードよりも速く表示して、性能が良いように見せかけることを業界の隠語で「メーターをテンプラする」などと言う。
sen.e: When a car is disguised to be one with a better performance by showing faster speed than the actual driving, it is called 'tempura the meter' in jargon.
When a car is disguised to be one with a better performance by showing faster speed than when actually driven, it is called 'tempura the meter' in jargon.
When a car is disguised to be one with a better performance by showing faster speed than when in fact driven, it is called 'tempura the meter' in jargon.

sen.j: 正規に登録された乗用車の車台番号のものと異なる偽造ナンバープレートを取り付けたものを「天ぷらナンバー」という。
sen.e: When a car carries a forged car registration plate stating a wrong number instead of the undercarriage number which has been registered for the vehicle, it is called 'tempura number.'
When a car carries a forged car registration plate stating a wrong number instead of the undercarriage number which has been registered for the vehicle, it is called 'tempura number.'
When a car carries a forged car registration plate stating a wrong number instead of the undercarriage number which has been registered for the vehicle, it is called 'tempura number.'

sen.j: 路盤を整備せずに表面だけ舗装することを、「天ぷら舗装」という。
sen.e: It is called 'tempura hoso (pavement)' to only surface a street without overhauling its road base.
It is called 'tempura hoso (pavement)' to only surface a street without overhauling its road base.
It is called 'tempura hoso (pavement)' to only surface a street without overhauling its road base.

sen.j: 学籍がないにもかからわず勝手に制服を着用して学生に成りすます者、あるいは無断で講義を聴講に来る者を、「天ぷら学生」という。
sen.e: In spite of non-enrolment, a person disguised to be a student wearing a school uniform or attending a class without permission is called 'tempura gakusei (student).'
In spite of non-enrolment, a person disguised to be a student wearing a school uniform or attending a class without permission is called 'tempura gakusei (student).'

sen.j: （語源は「衣だけ」という意味）
sen.e: (Word origin means 'only coating.'
(Word origin means 'only coating.'

sen.j: 主に新聞業界等において架空契約の事を「テンプラ」という。
sen.e: Principally in news paper industries, illusory contracts are called 'tempura.'
Principally in the newspaper industry, illusory contracts are called 'tempura.'

sen.j: サラブレッド及びアングロアラブの血統をごまかすのも「てんぷら」という。
sen.e: To cover up the bloodline of a thoroughbred horse and Anglo-Arabian horse is called 'tempura.'
